title: The Second Census
summary: Numbers 26 records a second census of the Israelite men after the older generation died in the wilderness. This new count prepares them to enter the Promised Land, and the land will be divided based on the size of each tribe.

faq.question: Why was a second census taken?
faq.answer: To count the new generation that would enter the Promised Land.

faq.question: What happened to the men from the first census?
faq.answer: They all died in the wilderness, as God had decreed after their rebellion.
